instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good” and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Liquid damage minimal - <RESISTOR>R5117</RESISTOR>, replaced.

Inspected board at 45x, no signs of further liquid damage.

PPBUS = 8.6
3V42 = 3V42
S5 rails = 3V3 and 5V

<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> = 3V3
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> = 0V

No power cycles

Any thoughts please?

UPDATE: Replaced <RESISTOR>R1451</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.
Now fan spins up for 10 seconds and then off. Connected a fully charged working battery to check for USB initialization but nothing. <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> goes high while fan spins.
Also powers on from battery in the same way but no mouse LED. CPU does get hot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: CPU Vcore present I assume? This could really be anything, corrosion under SMC or something stupid.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 24949"]CPU Vcore present I assume? This could really be anything, corrosion under SMC or something stupid.[/QUOTE]

All power is there for the time the fan spins, incliding CPU.
i already put another SMC on there just to check if there was crap I could not UC out of there.

Guess I'll check all the PCH signals and see if that leads to anything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: This one will suck, these symptoms can be anything really.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 24987"]This one will suck, these symptoms can be anything really. [/QUOTE]

Yep, I know.... These things are like a black hole. Every now and then I gravitate toward it and before I know it, I've lost an entire day.
But, I post in hope.

Never mind, it's going back.

Thanks Duke.
